page.title: 14Media Flintham/Syerston.
page.content:
In 1983 a quarterly{newsletter}was started in Flintham, subsidised by the Parish Council. All aspects of village life are covered, frequently tongue in cheek. The school children illustrate most of the magazine which is a lively publication used as an example to other villagers starting their own magazine. Syerston followed Flintham's example and started their own smaller scale broadsheet in 1984. There is some light-hearted rivalry between editors!
Most houses in both villages have TV's with a high % of videos and hi-fi sets.
The Nottingham Evening Post, a{daily {newspaper}and The Newark Advertiser are delivered to both villages.
